sections.title: Prerequisites
sections.content:
Before deploying NeMo Microservices, ensure you have:

‚Ä¢ **NGC API Key** - Get yours at https://org.ngc.nvidia.com/setup/api-key
‚Ä¢ **Kubernetes Cluster** - For Helm deployments (kind, k3s, minikube, or cloud)
‚Ä¢ **Docker & Docker Compose** - For Docker Compose deployments
‚Ä¢ **kubectl & helm** - Command-line tools installed and configured
‚Ä¢ **Sufficient Resources** - NeMo requires significant memory and GPU for some services

sections.title: NGC API Key Requirements
sections.content:
Your NGC API key must have the following scopes/permissions:

**Required Scopes:**
‚Ä¢ **NGC Catalog** - Access to pull container images from nvcr.io
‚Ä¢ **Private Registry** - Pull Helm charts and NeMo microservice images
‚Ä¢ **Cloud Functions** - Ability to invoke NGC endpoints and functions

**How to verify:**
1. Go to https://org.ngc.nvidia.com/setup/api-key
2. Check that your key has access to the nemo-microservices resources
3. Ensure your organization has NeMo Microservices entitlements

**Common permission errors:**
‚Ä¢ `401 Unauthorized` - Key lacks required scopes
‚Ä¢ `403 Forbidden` - Organization not entitled to NeMo
‚Ä¢ `ImagePullBackOff` - Key cannot pull from nvcr.io/nvidia/nemo-microservices

sections.title: What Happens When You Deploy
sections.content:
**Docker Compose Flow:**
1. Your NGC API key is set as an environment variable
2. Docker Compose reads the configuration
3. Images are pulled from nvcr.io using your key
4. All NeMo services start in containers

**Helm Chart Flow:**
1. Your NGC API key authenticates with NGC Helm registry
2. The Helm chart is fetched (if auto-fetch is enabled)
3. Chart is extracted and customized with your API key
4. Kubernetes resources are created in the 'nemo' namespace
5. Images are pulled using imagePullSecrets configured with your key
6. Pods start running NeMo microservices

sections.title: Deployment Options
sections.content:
**Helm with Auto-Fetch** - Automatically downloads the specified version of the NeMo Helm chart from NGC, then deploys it. This is the recommended option for getting started.

**Helm (Local Chart)** - Uses a Helm chart that already exists in your local directory. Choose this if you've already downloaded the chart or made custom modifications.

**Docker Compose** - Deploys NeMo using Docker Compose. Simpler than Helm but less flexible. Best for single-node deployments and development.

sections.title: Supported Versions
sections.content:
**NeMo Microservices 25.12.0** - Latest release with newest features

**NeMo Microservices 25.10.0** - Previous stable release

Select the version that matches your requirements. If unsure, use the latest version (25.12.0).

sections.title: After Deployment
sections.content:
Once deployment completes:

**For Helm:**
‚Ä¢ Check status: `kubectl get pods -n nemo`
‚Ä¢ View logs: `kubectl logs -n nemo <pod-name>`
‚Ä¢ Access services: `kubectl get svc -n nemo`

**For Docker Compose:**
‚Ä¢ Check status: `docker-compose ps`
‚Ä¢ View logs: `docker-compose logs -f`
‚Ä¢ Access API: http://localhost:8000

The NeMo platform includes multiple microservices including Data Designer, Auditor, Evaluator, Guardrails, and more.

sections.title: Troubleshooting
sections.content:
**Common Issues:**

‚Ä¢ **Authentication Failed** - Verify your NGC API key is valid and has access to nemo-microservices
‚Ä¢ **Chart Not Found** - Ensure you have network access to helm.ngc.nvidia.com
‚Ä¢ **Pod Pending** - Check if your cluster has sufficient resources
‚Ä¢ **ImagePullBackOff** - Your NGC key may not have access to required images
‚Ä¢ **Connection Refused** - For local K8s, use native mode or host network mode

For detailed troubleshooting, check the deployment logs and consult the NeMo Microservices documentation.

sections.title: External Access
sections.content:
**Automatic Proxy:** After deployment, a reverse proxy starts on port `8080`. Point your tunnel there.

**How it works:** NeMo Studio calls `http://nemo.test:3000/v1/...` which browsers can't resolve. The proxy rewrites these to relative paths (`/v1/...`) that work with any tunnel URL.

**Prerequisites:** Enable ingress in your cluster:
‚Ä¢ microk8s: `microk8s enable ingress`
‚Ä¢ k3s: ingress is enabled by default
‚Ä¢ Other: install nginx-ingress controller

**Architecture:**
`Browser ‚Üí Tunnel ‚Üí nginx (:8080) ‚Üí K8s Ingress ‚Üí NeMo Services`

**Manual Control:**
‚Ä¢ Start: `bash nemo-proxy/start-proxy.sh`
‚Ä¢ Custom backend: `BACKEND=10.0.0.5:80 bash nemo-proxy/start-proxy.sh`
‚Ä¢ Stop: `docker stop nemo-proxy`

sections.title: Security Note
sections.content:
Your NGC API key is:
‚Ä¢ Passed as an environment variable to the deployment process
‚Ä¢ NOT stored permanently by this application
‚Ä¢ Used to authenticate with NGC registries
‚Ä¢ Configured as a Kubernetes secret (for Helm) or environment variable (for Docker Compose)

Never share your API key or commit it to version control.
